SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

solidstack.cache
Class SimpleCache

java.lang.Object
  solidstack.cache.SimpleCache

public class SimpleCache
extends Object

The SimpleCache does things as simple as possible.

  • User code is responsible for refreshing a value in the cache whenever the cache signals it.
  • It uses non-blocking retrieval, even if a value in the cache is in the process of being refreshed by another thread. It will temporarily get the old version of the value instead or null if the value does not yet exist in the cache. This means that when the value does not yet exist in the cache, in very rare cases multiple threads could be busy refreshing a specific value, but this should not pose any problem.
  • This cache does not care about memory. It will hold on to every value that gets stored in it. Each hour however, all values that are not refreshed within the last hour will be purged.
  • No extra threads are used. Everything is done in the calling thread.

Since:
2005
Author:
René de Bloois

Method Detail

getCache

public static SimpleCache getCache()
Gets the default global cache.

Returns:
The default global cache.

getTime

protected long getTime()
Returns the current time in milliseconds. This method could be overridden in a subclass to simulate time in a unit test.

Returns:
The current time in milliseconds.

put

public SimpleCache.CacheEntry put(Object value,
                                  Object... key)
Store a value with the specified key. The value gets the default expiration interval. Nulls can also be stored in the cache, but in that case care must be taken to always use getEntry(Object...) to detect if the null value exists in the cache or has been expired.

Parameters:
key - The key used to store the value in the cache.
value - The value that should be stored in the cache.
Returns:
The cache entry in which the value is stored.

get

public <T> T get(Object... key)
Retrieve a value with the specified key. If the value does not exist or the value is expired this method returns null. In case the value is expired its expiration time will be extended to give the current thread a chance to refresh the value. This method can not be used to retrieve null values from the cache because you wouldn't be able to distinguish between null and expired.

Parameters:
key - The key of the value that should be retrieved.
Returns:
The value with the specified key, or null if not found or expired.

getEntry

public SimpleCache.CacheEntry getEntry(Object... key)
Retrieve a cache entry corresponding with the specified key. If the entry does not exist in the cache or is expired this method returns null. In case the value is expired its expiration time will be extended to give the current thread a chance to refresh the value. This method should be used whenever null values need to be stored in the cache.

Parameters:
key - The key of the value that should be retrieved.
Returns:
the cache entry with the specified key, or null if not found or expired.

getExpirationMillis

public int getExpirationMillis()
Returns the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires.

Returns:
the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires.

setExpirationMillis

public void setExpirationMillis(int expirationMillis)
Sets the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires.

Parameters:
expirationMillis - the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires.

getExtendMillis

public int getExtendMillis()
Returns the number of milliseconds the expiration of a cache entry will be extended after the first cache miss for this entry. This gives the thread that got the cache miss a chance to refresh the data in the cache.

Returns:
The number of milliseconds the expiration of a cache entry will be extended after the first cache miss for this entry.

setExtendMillis

public void setExtendMillis(int extendMillis)
Sets the number of milliseconds that the expiration of a cache entry will be extended after the first cache miss. This gives the thread that got the cache miss a chance to refresh the data in the cache.

Parameters:
extendMillis - The number of milliseconds the expiration of a cache entry will be extended after the first cache miss for this entry.
